title: Hidden Hunger Index vs. share of energy intake from cereals, roots and tubers
units: [{"property":"x","visible":true,"title":"Share of energy from cereals, roots and tubers","unit":"%","format":""},{"property":"y","visible":true,"title":"Hidden Hunger Index","unit":"","format":""},{"property":"size","visible":true,"title":"","unit":"","format":""}]
subtitle: The Hidden Hunger Index in pre-school children (HHI-PD), measured as an index of three deficiency prevalence estimates: preschool children affected by stunting, anemia due to iron deficiency, and vitamin-A deficiency, measured against the share of energy intake derived from cereals, roots and tubers (an indication of poor dietary diversity) in a given population. The HHI-PD score ranges between the best and worst possible scores of 0 and 100.
